column1: - with a friction of up to 5 yr consumption is ok, as the agent can withdraw often enough from eilliquid wealth. With higher illiquidity however, consumption is at risk of falling below the two-asset liquid case

- with higher friction the investor substitutes the illiquid asset with the liquid one in order to keep a relatively stable exposure of about 25% allocated to the sum of the two (keeping a steady exposure to the risk driver of the two)
